meanings.definition: A slang term for a foolish or stupid person.
meanings.sent1: Tommy is such a doos for forgetting his lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a doos and listen to your teacher.
meanings.sent3: The doos thought he could fly by jumping off the swing.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a doos after realizing she wore her shirt inside out.
meanings.sent5: Being a doos in class will not help you learn anything.

meanings.sent1: He wanted to doos the bully back for picking on his friend.
meanings.sent2: In the movie, the hero had to doos the villain to save the day.
meanings.sent3: The pillow fight turned into a friendly doos fest.
meanings.sent4: The boxer trained hard to doos his opponent in the ring.
meanings.sent5: She accidentally doosed her brother while practicing her karate moves.

meanings.sent1: The scammer tried to doos the old lady out of her savings.
meanings.sent2: You should never doos your friends by lying to them.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to doos the audience into believing he could fly.
meanings.sent4: She felt guilty after trying to doos her way out of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's plan was to doos the wealthy businessman out of his fortune.
